paper.title: The use of fuzzy logic and expert judgment in the R&D project portfolio selection process
paper.abstract: New technologies emerge every day in response to a variety of needs. In research and development (R&D) project portfolio selection, the agencies responsible for budget allocation must make the crucial decision of which projects to fund. A quantitative, objective decision-making process necessarily avoids internal strife amongst decision-makers, and contributes to a more unbiased process. This paper proposes a new decision aid that integrates fuzzy logic and expert judgment into non-crisp decision making criteria for the R&D project portfolio selection process thereby reducing the number of solutions under consideration. Managers' preferences and knowledge are incorporated into the process using a fuzzy rule based aggregation procedure. This technique provides an alternative to clustering in choosing amongst non-dominated solutions. The methodology is illustrated through a case study, determining funding levels for R&D projects for the particular example of the Nuclear Emergency Safety Team (NEST).

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要讨论的是R&D项目组合选择过程中的决策辅助工具，虽然提到了'portfolio'一词，但其应用场景是研发项目的预算分配，而非金融领域的投资组合管理。论文的核心技术是模糊逻辑和专家判断，并未涉及衍生品定价或金融风险管理。
